intro: Wikstroemia leptophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf wikstroemia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or lowland forest habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
